{{also|Trinken}} ==German== {{wikipedia|dab=Trinken|lang=de}} ===Etymology=== From {{inh|de|gmh|trinken}}, from {{inh|de|goh|trinkan}} (attested since the 8th century), from {{inh|de|gem-pro|*drinkaną}}. The further etymology is currently unknown. Either the nasalized form is a direct descent from {{der|de|ine-pro|*dʰreǵ-||to draw with one's mouth, to pull}} and may be related to {{cog|sa|ध्रजति|tr=dhrajáti||to glide, to move steadily, to fly|sc=Deva}} or it has been borrowed from a non-Indo-European language as a substrate.Pfeifer, Wolfgang. 1995, 2005. ''Etymologisches Wörterbuch des Deutschen.'' München: dtv. {{ISBN|3423325119}}. Germanic cognates with identical meaning include {{cog|osx|drinkan}} (and {{cog|nds|drinken}}), {{cog|odt|drinkan}} (and {{cog|nl|drinken}}, {{cog|af|drink}}), {{cog|ang|drincan}} (and Modern {{cog|en|drink}}), {{cog|ofs|drinka}} (and {{cog|fy|drinke}}), {{cog|non|drekka}} (and {{cog|is|drekka}}, {{cog|fo|drekka}}, {{cog|no|drikke}}, {{cog|sv|dricka}}, {{cog|da|drikke}}), {{cog|got|𐌳𐍂𐌹𐌲𐌺𐌰𐌽}} and {{cog|xvn|drincan}}. ===Pronunciation=== * {{IPA|de|/ˈtʁɪŋkən/|[ˈtrɪŋʔŋ̩]|[ˈtʁɪŋkŋ̩]}} * {{audio|de|De-trinken.ogg|audio (Germany)}} * {{audio|de|De-at-trinken.ogg|audio (Austria)}} * {{rhymes|de|ɪŋkən}} * {{hyphenation|de|trin|ken}} ===Verb=== {{de-verb-strong|class=3|trinkt|trank|getrunken|past subjunctive=tränke}} # {{lb|de|transitive}} to [[drink]] {{gloss|to consume (a liquid) through the mouth or the liquid contained within (a bottle, glass, etc.)}} # {{lb|de|intransitive}} to [[drink]] {{gloss|to consume alcoholic beverages}} # {{lb|de|intransitive}} to [[drink]]; to [[toast]] {{gloss|engage in a salutation (of someone), accompanying the raising of glasses while drinking alcohol}} # {{lb|de|reflexive}} to [[drink]] one's fill; to drink to [[satiety]] ====Conjugation==== {{de-conj-strong|trink|trank|getrunken|h|||tränk|a}} ====Derived terms==== * {{l|de|antrinken}} * {{l|de|austrinken}} * {{l|de|betrinken}} * {{l|de|ertrinken}} * {{l|de|Getränk|g=n}} * {{l|de|Trank|g=m}} * {{l|de|tränken}} * {{l|de|Trinken|g=n}} * {{l|de|Trinker|g=m}} * {{l|de|Trinkgeld|g=n}} * {{l|de|Trinkglas}} * {{l|de|Trinkwasser|g=n}} * {{l|de|Trunk|g=m}} * {{l|de|Wasser predigen und Wein trinken}} ===References=== ===Further reading=== * {{R:Duden}} [[Category:de:Drinking]] ---- ==Middle High German== ===Etymology=== From {{inh|gmh|goh|trinkan}}, from {{inh|gmh|gem-pro|*drinkaną}}. Cognate with {{cog|en|drink}}, {{cog|nl|drinken}}, {{cog|osx|drinkan}}. ===Verb=== {{head|gmh|verb}} # {{lb|gmh|transitive}} to [[drink]] # {{lb|gmh|intransitive}} to [[drink]]; to [[toast]] ====Conjugation==== {{gmh-conj-IIIa|tr|nk}} ====Descendants==== * {{desc|gsw|trinke}} *: Italian Walser: {{l|gsw|trenhu}}, {{l|gsw|trénge}}, {{l|gsw|tringhien}}, {{l|gsw|trinche}} * {{desc|bar|-}} *: {{desc|cim|trinkhan|alts=1}} *: {{desc|mhn|trinken}} *: Udinese: {{l|bar|trinkn}}, {{l|bar|trinkhn}}, {{l|bar|trinckn}} * {{desc|gmw-cfr|drenke|alts=1}}, {{l|gmw-cfr|drinke}} *: {{desc|hrx|drinke}} * {{desc|de|trinken}} * {{desc|lb|drénken}} * {{desc|gmw-rfr|-}} *: {{desc|pdc|drinke}} * {{desc|wym|trynkja}} * {{desc|yi|טרינקען}} * {{desc|bor=1|fr|trinquer}} * {{desc|bor=1|gl|trincar}} * {{desc|bor=1|it|trincare}} * {{desc|bor=1|es|trincar}} * {{desc|bor=1|vec|trincar|alts=1}} ---- ==Mòcheno== ===Verb=== {{head|mhn|verb}} # to [[drink]] ===References=== * Umberto Patuzzi, ed., (2013) [http://www.lusern.it/documenti/Centro_documentazione/libri-depliant-att--didattica-relazioni-etc-/libri/le-nostre-parole-luserna.pdf Ünsarne Börtar], Luserna: Comitato unitario delle linguistiche storiche germaniche in Italia / Einheitskomitee der historischen deutschen Sprachinseln in Italien.
